description: Based on Ancient Greek φιλαυτία (philautía, “self-love, self-regard”), fopm φιλέω (philéō, “I love”), and αὐτός (autós, “self”).

examples: Every Man thinks his own Geese Swans. This Proverb intimates that an inbred Philauty runs through the whole Race of Flesh and Blood and that Self-love is the Mother of Vanity, Pride, and Mistake. It turns a Man's Geese into Swans, his Dunghill Poultry into Pheasants and his Lambs into Venison.
